comment: If you have the chance to take Auditing as a Maymester with McComb, do it! I thought my life was gonna be hell for 2 weeks, but it was actually super chill. Easy A I swear. Dude is pretty cool, and the entire class time is pretty much spent going over each bullet point on the study guide for the exams. Very straightforward and simple material.

Made acct feel easy and McGraw hill helped me thru trial and error. Almost all assignments have 2 chances. Tests are identical to study guides. plenty of extra credit. He responds quick and is very helpful. Ended the class with a 100. made me fall in love with accounting, i wish i could get him again for accounting 2.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This is the most disorganized class I've ever taken. The work you do in Connect has no relation to exams. He misses so many days for personal reasons and acts like it's not a big deal. The final left out the last unit because he felt like we understood well it enough when it was the easiest topic by far. Unfair and terrible professor

He has the worst exam format. It's one big financial statement, and if you mess up a single part, you're probably getting a D. The grade you receive does not reflect your understanding of the material at all. HW problems have no relation to exams so come to class or fail

Great professor, tries his best to make a boring class a little more interesting and really cares about the well being of his students, would definitely take again, attendance isn't really mandatory but does give extra credit if you just show up sometimes.

It seems like teaching is just a hobby for him. He spends more time trying to convince you to work in public accounting rather than teaching the course. We lost a day because of the hurricane and still canceled 3 classes after for no good reason. Material is simple so not hard to teach yourself.

He's the best professor for this ACCT class. The tests were scary by looking at it but it's easy. The key is to pass his class is study the Comp. Reviews trust me, his tests are copy and paste from the reviews exactly 98% all the time. So, if you want to pass, study the reviews repeatedly like 10x  until you memorize the questions and comfortably.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment:
When I hear this professor's name my immediate reaction is just a "hell yeah". Super cool dude. He went on vacation with Paul McCartney in Mexico over Thanksgiving. I'd run through a brick wall for him. 

Class is fairly difficult material-wise, but he tells you where to focus and props you up for success. I can not recommend this class enough.
Quite possibly the best professor I have ever had. I have learned more with Professor McComb than with every other professor I have ever had combined. Take him!!!!!!

Professor McComb is easily one of my top 3 professors I've had at KSU. He's a career accountant and truly knows the content. The class is tough but if you put in an ounce of effort, you will be totally fine. There was a ton of extra credit and help sessions, curves on every exam. He really wants his students to be successful in school/careers.

Professor McComb is a nice guy. Cares a lot about the class and you can tell he genuinely cares about accounting. Gives a lot of bonus points and curves tests. I hardly showed up to class and still did well, mainly because of said bonus points/curves. A couple group projects, nothing too hard. Difficult class, obviously, but he makes it okay.

The first half of the class is very easy & is mainly journal entries. The second half is a little harder, but you constantly go over examples in class, so it will get drilled into your head. This class is not difficult. If you show up & go through the examples, you will learn everything you need to. No tricks. Great guy. Many extra credit points.

He clearly explains everything you need to know for exams and assignments. Online homework & quizzes are easy & straight from the book. Study the phrasing from the book for portion of the final exam that the accounting department develops & you'll be fine. Great guy who knows his stuff & has plenty of experience to back it up. Participate in class.
Guys a fantastic teacher. One of the most caring professors Ive met. I cant recommend him enough for both Audit and International Accounting. Take him you wont regret it.

Hes a very caring human being. Due to Covid-19 lectures were done on Collaborate and he gave his best. It is super hard to teach Auditing online and he did a pretty good job. Take him, he loves auditing and will teach you everything you need to know to pass the class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Solid professor overall. Lectures were pretty helpful; very clear with the instructions on assignments; gives us a study guide each test so we know exactly what to expect on them. Attendance not mandatory, but Id recommend going because he may assign something to be turned in by the next class, and there will be no reminders.

He is a great human and teacher. I love the fact that sometimes he ends class early. He is always willing to help his students and answer questions respectfully and clear. The one thing I was not happy with is that he gives short notice on homework. He assigns homework 2 days before he wants it turned in.

I took McComb for ACCT4150 & ACCT4300, and both were awesome classes. He has very clear grading criteria, is responsive to emails, has no problem answering your questions, etc. I would 100% take him again, and I recommend him to everyone that asks.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. McComb is pretty great!!!! Truly an easy class and it makes it enjoyable. Just study what is given in class, and you will do just fine (literally). If you want a bomb ass professor, take McComb!! I plan on taking him for another class next semester.

Prof. McComb is pretty great. Truly an easy class. I had a 98% before the final exam. It's very simple to do actually, just study what is given in class, and you will do just fine. Some people in the class were barely passing, and I just don't understand how this is possible. My group of friends are doing very well in it.

I love love love McComb. I took him for two classes this semester because he came highly recommended. He is extremely fair and willing to help his students succeed. All you have to do is try. International accounting is awful, but McComb makes it bearable. But, you HAVE TO go to class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you will fail if you don't go.
he is one of the best professors! he makes you understand the material and gives extra credit. its hard not to pass his class

Homework,and tests done in Connect. Learn Smart chapter must be completed every week. Lecture consists of minimal powerpoint slides, lots of excel usage.  If you are a student who like the conceptual framework to be discussed and examples given on a white board, this may not be the class for you.I'm an A student, and I had to work for my B.

Homework, tests done in McGraw Hill Connect.  Learn Smart chapter must be completed every week. Quickly rolls through examples in class. Three exams including final. I didn't do well on tests but had enough points with everything else to pull off a C. I am normally an AB student.

Professor McComb is a GREAT teacher and he really ares about his students and their success in his class. He is fair and will help you any way he possibly can. He teaches you what you need to know and makes his class so enjoyable. If you have a chance to choose a class he is teaching, Grab it! You want be disappointed. McComb is GREAT!

He will help you any way he can. Just go see him during his office hours. He's very understanding of things that happen and lots of assignments can be done remotely if you just communicate with him. His lectures are kinda long and boring, but he gives a ton of bonus points. The class isn't easy, but he gives many opportunities to succeed.

Prof. McComb is amazing. He explains things clearly and he really cares about understanding. He gives chance after chance to get good grades in his class. He has a very dry personality, but he's really good at explaining. Exams are just like exercises in class. Take this professor. He's amazing!!
Best accounting professor at KSU!  I have taken him 3 times!  Tests follow practice homework, and extra credit is offered throughout the semester through pop quizzes!

McComb is one of the best professors I have ever taken.  He is more than willing to do whatever he can to help you.  International Accounting is HARD!!!!! but he tries to make it as simple and easy to understand as possible.  I defiantly recommend him

I cant find words to describe him. he is naturally a nice guy. but the class is difficult but he tries to make sure everyone understands the material. take him for acct 4300 and 4100. best accounting professor.

I have had him for 2 classes.  For 4300, he or Smalt (in that order) are the only two I would even consider taking.  International is a very difficult course, and the tests reflect that.  However, I can say from experience he will do everything he can to help you out throughout the class.

Professor only goes over Learn Smart practice problems in class, doesn't teach. Only 4 test and Learn Smart problems apply towards grade,no extra credit and no real study guides provided. If you don't know the concepts backwards and forward you are screwed on the test!  Better not have a life outside of this class if you want to do well.
Best professor for accounting. Very helpful and always willing to help out. Really cares about the class. He made coming to class easy.

I've taken Professor for 4 classes and would definitely recommend him to anyone. He is extremely helpful and willing to stay after to answer any questions. He is one of the best professors in the accounting department and he made attending class pleasurable.

This is just a hard class in general. Prof is very sweet but it is tough to make it through his lectures. And the tests are VERY hard (mult choice & long answer). Thankfully there is HW, group and participation points to make up for the brutal exams.

Professor is not hard but the subject is. He really tries to help and to keep the class engaged. Homework, tests and quizzes, group work and some extra credit. He tries to help you to pass the class. Would take him again even though I didnt get an A. Best choice out there.

Auditing is a cumbersome subject on which to take a course, but the prof did his best to relate it to the career. He was forgiving on the semester-long audit case(total of 5 assignments). Take-home midterm and heavily-weighted final exams. Various weekly participation assignments. I got an A. The prof handled this class better than he did Adv Fin.
Definately not hard. He is very straight forward with the tests. He is very forgiving with the cases also. Take him, you won't regret it.

Great teacher! He is very helpful even though the material is very hard. You must read the chapters. If you get behind it will show on the tests. The most work I have done in a class, but he is always willing to help.

Three take-home exams and a couple of minor "projects". Made my very first 'B' in this class. The material is mind-numbing and complex. I made the mistake of procrastinating reading the text. The prof. is mostly fair with grades, despite being a poor lecturer.

Took him for Acct 4100 and it was not hard. In class portion test was very very easy.Take home portion was little harder, but if you go to class and pay attention then you should be fine.Put little effort and you can get an "A". He's super nice and very helpful. Taking him again for Acct 4150 and Acct 4300 :)

He is nice but he really needs to learn how to teach. He just reads power points, shows answers to HW and doesn't explain anything. I learned nothing from him. I can't believe KSU let him teach more 4000-level courses this fall semester. If you are a serious accounting major, avoid him! (although there aren't much choice)
Class was not easy. But, if you have any questions, just go to his office. He will help you. He's very nice and genuinely wants everyone to do well. Offers extra credit. I'd definitely recommend him.

He is super nice. His tests are hard. Most of the time, the tests didn't cover everything that was taught. Just some things. He will explain anything you ask. Go to his office if you need help and you will be fine. I would definitely recommend him!!!

Mixed feelings. He sure is nice; but he has a tendency to skim though the chapters; then - bam - material he skipped through shows up on the test. Test ARE hard, including take-home portion. Class can be extremely boring, unless you are an ACC enthusiast. Curves pretty generously.

Class was extremely hard. The professor is very approachable and sincere but the workload is overly strenuous and material does not add up to what's shown on the tests. Comprehensive final is ridiculously challenging.Worst test grade isn't dropped either. Stay away and take Chambers instead

Professor is not as helpful at the others suggest. Hist test are extremely hard and completely different form the lectures. I would suggest taking another professor if at all possible. If not, good luck pulling off a B after studying 30 hrs for an exam.

Very Nice professor and always willing to help. That being said, his class is ridiculously hard. Material taught in class does not add up to the tests that are given. Its almost like looking at a foreign language. If you want to make anything above a C,I suggest taking another professor.
Good Professor. Tests are not hard. Part of the test is take home portion, don't wait till the last minute. If you have questions he will help you.
